channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report X-2024110412
item.description:
Report X-2024110412

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-15T12:23:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-05
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with a UN spec marking and warning sticker was presented to the spill agent at the HNBA location. The spill agent checked the packing spill that contained a SDS stating the contents were UN3175 class 4. There were no DG markings or paperwork attached for transportation. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and is being held at the location.

item.title: Report E-2024110209
item.description:
Report E-2024110209

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-14T12:23:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-22
  • City: Greenwood
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) gallons of product released from one (1) 275-gallon plastic tote. Personnel advised that release was due to a packaging failure. Dayton Freight personnel confirmed they cleaned release using Oil Dri absorbent. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110163
item.description:
Report E-2024110163

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-10T12:20:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-17
  • City: ELKHART
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of ethyl methyl Ketone released from one (1) fifty-five (55) gallon metal drum. The release impacted inside trailer floor. Dayton Freight cleaned release using appropriate PPE available on site. Personnel completed cleanup and generated one (1) fifty-five (55) gallon poly drum of waste. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
